Package dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.roborally.controller

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
dk.dtu.compute.se.pisd.roborally.controller.GameController
@RestController public class GameController extends Object
Controller for managing the game logic of RoboRally. It handles player movements, command execution, and the transition between different phases of the game.

The controller is responsible for starting the programming phase, executing programs, and moving players on the board based on their chosen command cards.

Usage: 


 Board board = new Board(8, 8);
 GameController controller = new GameController(board);
 controller.startProgrammingPhase();
 // ...
Author:
Ekkart Kindler, ekki@dtu.dk, Emily, s191174, Jacob, s164958, Setare, s232629

    • startProgrammingPhase

      public void startProgrammingPhase()
      This method starts the programming phase of the game. It sets the phase to PROGRAMMING, sets the current player to the first player, and sets the step to 0.

      It also sets the program fields of each player to be empty and fills the hand of the players with command cards from their decks.

      The method is called at the beginning of the game and after each activation phase.

    • finishProgrammingPhase

      public void finishProgrammingPhase()
      This method ends the programming phase, which makes the execute button active to press.

    • executePrograms

      public void executePrograms()
      This method executes the moves which the player has requested

    • executeStep

      public void executeStep()
      This method executes the moves which the player has requested in step mode

      public void executeCommandOptionAndContinue(@NotNull Command option)
      This method executes the given command for the specified player.

    • executeCommand

      public void executeCommand(@NotNull Player player, Command command)
      Executes the given command for the specified player. If the command is POWER_UP, the player will receive one energy cube.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to whom the command will apply
      command - the command to be executed

    • moveThree

      public void moveThree(Player player)
      Moves a player three spaces forward in the direction they are currently facing. This is done by calling moveForward method three times.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to move three spaces forward

    • again

      public void again(Player player)
      Repeats the command card in the previous register of the player. If it is the first card it does nothing, if the previous card is an again card it will repeat the card before that.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to repeat the command card for

    • spam

      public void spam(Player player)
      This method draws a card from the drawpile and replace the current card with it.
      Parameters:
      player - the player to draw a card for

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      This method cleans up the program fields of the players and moves the cards to the discard pile.
